inclusion.criterion: severe degenerative high flow AS with echocardiographic criteria: aortic valve (AV) effective orifice area (EOA) of < 1 cm2, mean AV gradient of > 40 mmHg, or AV peak systolic velocity of > 4.0 m/s
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: TTE revealed severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function. EF was 25%. RV pressure was 41 and had biatrial enlargement.

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic from the AS (dyspnea in NYHA-class II or greater, angina pectoris, or syncope), or asymptomatic but with decreased left ventricular ejection fraction
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: He presented to his cardiologist on [**2148-10-1**] with progressive SOB and LE edema.

inclusion.criterion: symptomatic patients with severe low-flow, low-gradient (<40 mmHg) aortic stenosis with reduced ejection fraction and evidence of flow (contractile) reserve
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients surviveal time more than one year
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of an acute myocardial infarction 30 days before the intended treatment
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease.

exclusion.criterion: Aortic valve is a congenital unicuspid or congenital bicuspid valve, or is noncalcified
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient has a bicuspid aortic valve, but it's not specified if it's unicuspid or noncalcified.

exclusion.criterion: Mixed aortic stenosis and aortic regurgitation with predominant aortic regurgitation > 3+
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient has 2+ aortic insufficiency, but it's not specified if it's predominant.

exclusion.criterion: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with or without obstruction
exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: There is no mention of hypertrophic cardiomyopathy in the patient text.

notes: The patient's EF was 25%, which may be a concern for inclusion criterion 4. Additionally, the patient's life expectancy is not specified, so it's unknown if they meet exclusion criterion 13.
